content:
1. Setting boundaries is selfish or controlling: Many people believe that setting boundaries is an act of selfishness or control. However, in reality, setting boundaries is a healthy and necessary part of any relationship.

2. Boundaries are unnecessary if you love someone: Love is not enough to sustain a healthy relationship. Boundaries are essential to maintaining a respectful and safe relationship.

3. Boundaries are only for romantic relationships: Many people believe that setting boundaries is only important in romantic relationships. However, boundaries are essential in all types of relationships, including friendships and family.

4. Setting boundaries will push people away: People often fear that if they establish boundaries, they will push their loved ones away. But in reality, healthy boundaries often strengthen relationships by fostering respect and understanding.

5. Boundaries need to be set in stone: People often believe that once they set boundaries, they cannot be changed. But the truth is that boundaries can and should evolve as relationships evolve.

6. Setting boundaries means you don't trust your partner: Boundaries are often seen as a sign of distrust, but the reality is that they are a way to build trust. By setting clear expectations and boundaries, both parties can feel secure in the relationship.

7. Boundaries are always easy to set: Setting boundaries can be difficult and uncomfortable, especially if you're not used to it. But with practice and communication, it can become easier and more natural.
